III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & COF Rule 400.10107 Employment policies and procedures;
Section establishment.
Description (1) A facility shall establish and follow written employment policies
and procedures that shall assure that staff are emotionally stable
and of suitable health, ability, experience, and education to
perform the duties assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff member was inappropriately touching multiple youth in
exchange for providing them reduced length of time at the facility
and may have had an inappropriate relationship with a youth. Staff
member has been removed from the facility at this time.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Complainant/Chief Administrator (CA) was interviewed face
to face at the facility on 2/9/23 in conjunction with MDHHS
Worker. CA reported Staff 1 had boundary issues with youth, so
they decided to put her through retraining. A performance
improvement plan was written for Staff 1, but it was not fully
executed because Staff 1 quit prior to all steps being
implemented. CA stated they frequently instruct staff to be
friendly, but not a friend. However, CA stated Staff 1 appeared like
she was more of a friend to the youth. Staff 1 told supervisors and
administrators she was a “mama bear” and a “toucher” and must
learn not to be. CA reported Staff 1 admitted she struggled with
boundaries but wanted to make sure she was looking out for the
youth. CA reported Staff 1 found out the youth were using a
computer program called “My Journal” to write messages back
and forth to each other. When administrators reviewed the
messages that youth were writing, they found a message written
by one youth stating Staff 1 was offering inappropriate sexual
favors for reduced sentences, specifically to Youth A and Youth B.
CA reported Staff 1 showed favoritism towards some youth. CA
reported Staff 1 quit on 2/6/23 due to the stress associated with
the situation.
Youth A and Youth C were interviewed face to face at the jail
on 2/9/23 and Youth B was interviewed via phone on 2/16/23
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. All youth reported they
haven’t heard anything about Staff 1 touching or interacting with
youth inappropriately. All youth reported Staff 1 has never touched
2

or interacted with them inappropriately. All youth reported Staff 1
never made them any promises.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at on the facility on
2/9/23 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Youth D reported
Staff 1 and Youth A would write notes to each other and after she
read them, she would throw them away. Youth D reported he did
not know what any of the notes said. Youth D reported Youth A
had the “golden hand” with all staff, including Staff 1. Youth D
reported one time he heard Staff 1 tell Youth A she doesn’t break
promises but does not know what she was referring to. Youth D
has not seen or heard of Staff 1 touching or interacting with youth
inappropriately.
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on 2/10/23 in conjunction
with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported she doesn’t know why it
would ever be said she offered to get someone’s sentenced
reduced in return for any kind of favor because she obviously has
no control or authority to do so. She reported she felt she had to
quit her job because these types of rumors could tarnish her
reputation. She felt if she returned to work, the youth would “eat
her alive” because they tend to attack any weakness they see,
and this would have been considered a weakness. Staff 1
admitted she has boundary issues, but she just wants to look out
for the youth there and felt she had to build a rapport to be able to
do that. She reported she talked about her personal life
sometimes and she talked to one youth about birth control one
time, and those situations are deemed inappropriate. She reported
she never touched or interacted with youth in a sexual or
inappropriate manner. She reported she never gave youth
advantages, presents or contraband.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 2/9/23 in
conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported she trained
Staff 1 and often had to tell Staff 1 not to sit on the couch with the
youth or instructed Staff 1 to separate herself from the youth. Staff
2 stated Staff 1 would have conversations with the youth about
things going on in her personal life, talk about her grandchildren,
etc., which were not appropriate for their role in the facility. Staff 2
reported Staff 1 tended to share too much information and was
like that with every youth, but seemed to have more conversations
with Youth A and Youth B. Besides Staff 1 being too friendly, Staff
2 did not hear or witness any interactions Staff 1 had with youth
that would be deemed inappropriate.
3

Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 2/9/23 in
conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported Staff 1
admitted she never worked in a job like this one before and she
was nervous. Staff 3 reported towards the beginning of Staff 1’s
employment, Staff 1 told Staff 3 she wasn’t worried about her
safety working with the youth at the facility because she knew her
job was protected. She told Staff 3 if she felt unsafe or threatened
in any way, she felt she could tell Youth A and Youth A would take
care of it. Staff 3 reported Staff 1 was very vocal about wanting to
treat the youth like her own kids. Staff 3 never worked on the
same shift as Staff 1 and never personally witnessed her verbal or
physical interactions with youth.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 2/9/23 in
conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Staff 4 reported she never
heard or witnessed Staff 1 say or do anything inappropriate with
any of the youth. Staff 4 reported one time a youth was very upset
and crying, so Staff 1 patted him on the back to console him, but
that was it. Staff 4 stated they documented the interaction in the
shift progress notes because it involved a physical touch, but
there were no concerns with it.
Staff 5 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 2/9/23 in
conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Staff 5 never worked on the
same pod as Staff 1 and never personally witnessed her verbal or
physical interactions with youth.
Supervisor was interviewed via phone on 2/10/23 in
conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor did not hear or
witness any inappropriate actions or words Staff 1 used during her
interactions with the youth. Supervisor reported Staff 1 was overly
involved with the youth and sometimes had boundary issues such
as whispering with the youth and/or sitting too close to them.
Supervisor reported she provided a lot of coaching for Staff 1.
When she would speak with Staff 1 about her concerns, Staff 1
would say “those are my boys, you just don’t understand; you got
it wrong”.
Administrator was interviewed via phone on 2/21/23 in
conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Administrator completed
random and frequent video audits to determine if staff were being
compliant with pod management. Administrator noticed Staff 1
often pushed professional boundaries with the youth, such as
telling them not to say something out loud and instructing them to
write notes instead. Administrator reported Staff 1 was very
friendly with all youth and was pushing professional boundaries,
4

specifically according to what the facility deems appropriate per
their professional boundaries policy. Administrator also stated
Staff 1 frequently had playful interactions with the youth.
Administrator stated she did not hear or witness any actions
where Staff 1 was sexually inappropriate with youth.
VIDEO REVIEWED:
Video footage from January 20, 2023 was reviewed. Staff 1 is
sitting at the table with four youth, including Youth A. She is seen
allowing Youth A to take a pencil and paper into his room, which
CA reported is not typically allowed as it is considered contraband.
Staff 1 had something in her eye and allowed Youth A to get close
to her face to look for something in her eye. There was no
physical contact between Staff 1 and Youth A. Staff 1 was seen
writing notes to Youth A on a paper towel, but it is unknown what
the notes said.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• “My Journal” entry dated 2/1/23 written by a youth at the
facility states two youth said Staff 1 is touching youth and
trying to get their time reduced.
• Staff 1’s Employee File was reviewed:
o Development plan for Staff 1 (2/27/23-4/28/23)
identifies “Professional Boundaries” as the focus of
the plan. Goal was to develop and maintain
professional boundaries/relationships with the youth
of the facility, which included re-training.
o Performance Evaluation for Staff 1 signed by Staff 1
on 12/5/22 states Staff 1 has been reminded to
continue to keep firm boundaries with youth.
o Performance Journal Note regarding Staff 1 written
by Supervisor dated 12/29/22 states she coached
Staff 1 on 12/28/22 regarding conversations,
boundary issues and pod management issues.
o Performance Journal Note regarding Staff 1 written
by CA dated 1/30/23 stating CA met with Staff 1 to
discuss the proposed performance improvement
plan regarding boundaries and pod management.
Notes Staff 1 admitted she has had boundary issues
in the past and is a “people person” and a “toucher”.
o Training log notes Staff 1 completed her initial
training regarding Professional Boundaries on
7/18/22.
5

• Muskegon County Juvenile Detention Center Orientation
and Training Manual/Employee Handbook (rev. 11/14/22):
o Includes a page of information outlining professional
boundaries between staff and youth. Notes
inappropriate emotional boundaries that blur
staff/youth relationships include developing
friendships with youth, keeping secrets with youth,
making promises, sharing personal information, etc.
o Once the Superintendent is made aware of possible
misconduct by an employee, an investigation will be
conducted to determine the validity of the allegations
as well as what corrective actions will follow.
• Personnel Code of Ethics Policy outlines relationships with
juveniles/colleagues/other professions/public, professional
conduct/practices, training procedures for staff, and
National Juvenile Detention Association Code of Ethics.
Staff 1 signed a Code of Ethics Acknowledgement of
Receipt stating she received, reviewed & understood this
policy on 6/27/22.
Analysis There was no evidence to support Staff 1 was inappropriately
touching youth in exchange for providing them reduced length of
time at the facility. It is clear Staff 1 lacked professional
boundaries with youth; however, the facility was appropriately
addressing this issue as evidenced by interviews with facility staff
as well as review of Staff 1’s employee file.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
6

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy.
It is recommended that the current license status be continued.
